Fermentation was kept between 20 - 25 degrees Celsius to retain the aromatic intensity. The ferments were pumped over four times daily and had two rack and returns during the ten days on skins. This helped maximise colour, flavour and tannin extraction from the skins. 40% of the blend was aged on new American and French oak staves for 6 months to add oak characters and improve structure.
